long_desc.thetext:
A generic graph response view is needed. This view will be used as a default view of the COSMOS UI. This view should be able to render the contents of any graph response in a generic way. There should be extension points to customize the specific contents of the graph response.
A table is a likely generic view since users at a glance can determine the number of records in the graph response. A table can scale the cmdbf query response better than a tree since the graph response will most likely be root level heavy (i.e. the tree will contain a large number of root notes rather than many leaf nodes).
A tool bar should be provided that provides filtering and searching capability. Searching capability may be complicated. Filtering capability can be the definition of a cmdbf query.
Investigation is needed to flatten the cdmbf query response schema to a table view. One idea is to have a details view that shows the xml fragment or a customized view.
*** Bug 213222 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Retargetting to i9 based on AG call on Jan 16/08
Reassigning to Martin as per our meeting
Changing to P2 since this is targeted for i9.

Created attachment 90200 Outputter for GraphResponseViewer and JUnit tests
This is the code for the outputter and its corresponding junit test suite. including all the artifacts that the junit needs.

Please see the Design Document for the Manual tests that are required to test the Visualization part of this ER:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/COSMOS_Design_214145#GraphResponseViewer_Widgets_Manual_Testing

(In reply to comment #6) > Please see the Design Document for the Manual tests that are required to test > the Visualization part of this ER: > > http://wiki.eclipse.org/COSMOS_Design_214145#GraphResponseViewer_Widgets_Manual_Testing >
Martin, I suggest creating TPTP manual test suites to better track the test cases.
Ali, could you expand on that a little? I am not aware of the TPTP manual tests.

TPTP manual tests are a way to record the steps in written form required to execute a test that cannot be automated. The advantage to using them instead of writing the steps on a wiki page is that all the tests (manual and automated) are kept in the same place, and you can still track the results of the tests in CVS (and get them reported on the build status) just like you can for automated ones.
With TPTP 4.4.0 and earlier, the TPTP manual tests are available in the all-in-one package - just to to the New > Other > Test menu and you will see it there. If you have TPTP 4.5.0 (which is needed with Eclipse 3.4), then you will have to install an additional zip found on the TPTP downloads page. I need to make sure this additional step is listed on the i9 development environment page.

Created attachment 90726 TPTP Manual Test for GraphResponseViewer
This is the TPRP Manual test for the GraphResponseViewer, that uses the SML MDR.

Created attachment 90848 TPTP Manual Test ExampleMDR - GraphResponseViewer
This is the TPTP Manual test that shows relationships in the GraphResponseViewer. The test assumes that the user has generated the CMDBF Query, and submitted it to show the GraphResponseViewer.
ER Resolved with all dependant bugs Resolved/Fixed

QA Review of JUnits and Manual Tests: - Found TPTP Manual tests under DataVisualization.UI.Component.Widget.testsuite - QA has executed above TPTP manual tests, found few issues and filed bugs (221119,221121)
